boardgame.description: Bohnanza is the first in the Bohnanza family of games and has been published in several different editions._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The cards are colorful depictions of beans in various descriptive poses, and the object is to make coins by planting fields (sets) of these beans and then harvesting them. To help players match their cards up, the game features extensive trading and deal making. One of the most unique features of the game is that you cannot rearrange your hand, as you need to play the cards in the order that you draw them._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The original German edition supports 3-5 players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The English version from Rio Grande Games comes with the first edition of the first German expansion included in a slightly oversized box. One difference in the contents, however, is that bean #22's Weinbrandbohne (Brandy Bean) was replaced by the Wachsbohne, or Wax Bean. This edition includes rules for up to seven players, like the Erweiterungs-Set, but also adapts the two-player rules of Al Cabohne in order to allow two people to play Bohnanza._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Rio Grande Games* Please contact us to let us know which one you want. Rio Grande Games (RIO 155) $13.99 [Bohnanza] Rio Grande Games (RIO 349) $10.49 [Bohnanza Fan Edition] ** Type: Card Games Number of players: 2-7 Age of players: 10+ Length: 45 minutes Game Description: This great card game is about planting, trading, and selling beans - 11 kinds of beans (this English version includes all the cards from the original game and the first expansion). Players try to collect large sets of beans to sell for gold. There is limited growing space and always new beans to plant. To avoid planting unwanted beans, players trade them to other players who want them for their bean fields. Author: Uwe Rosenberg Bohnanza Fan Edition Type: Card Games Number of players: 3-5 Age of players: 12+ Length: 45 minutes Game Description: Each player plants beans in 2 or 3 fields and tries to sell them as profitably as possible. When selling beans, a player earns more gold for more beans of the same variety. The goal of the game is it to earn the most gold planting, harvesting, and selling beans. Without careful planning, players may be forced to harvest and sell their beans before they are ready and at lower prices than they hoped. In fact, sometimes a harvest brings no gold at all.The difference in this version from the original is that all the bean pictures are different and were supplied by fans of the game from around the world. Author: Uwe Rosenburg

Rio Grande Games (RIO 155) $12.49 [Bohnanza] Rio Grande Games (RIO 349) $9.49 [Bohnanza Fan Edition] ** Type: Card Games Number of players: 2-7 Age of players: 13+ Length: 45 minutes Game Description: This great card game is about planting, trading, and selling beans - 11 kinds of beans (this English version includes all the cards from the original game and the first expansion). Players try to collect large sets of beans to sell for gold. There is limited growing space and always new beans to plant. To avoid planting unwanted beans, players trade them to other players who want them for their bean fields. Bohnanza Fan Edition: Type: Card Games Number of players: 3-5 Age of players: 12+ Length: 45 minutes Game Description: Each player plants beans in 2 or 3 fields and tries to sell them as profitably as possible. When selling beans, a player earns more gold for more beans of the same variety. The goal of the game is it to earn the most gold planting, harvesting, and selling beans. Without careful planning, players may be forced to harvest and sell their beans before they are ready and at lower prices than they hoped. In fact, sometimes a harvest brings no gold at all.The difference in this version from the original is that all the bean pictures are different and were supplied by fans of the game from around the world.
